text:
I am using a JSP which has the following header
response.setHeader("Content-type","text/html; charset=utf-8")
response.setContentType("text/html; charset=utf-8")
Even the <@ page ContentType > directive does not work.
This is not setting the content type to UTF-8 . I have greek and Latin 
characters which are to be displayed in Tomcat4.0.6 when I am using the 
following html META tag.
<META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">

But in Tomcat4.1.18 . It is not rendering the characters properly . 

The above problem does not occur with Tomcat4.0.4 also. 
Is there a fix for this in Tomcat4.1.18 or can we take it as bug till a 
resolution is found.
